characters: ON MS. SQUIBBLES AND OOZMA FANS
ON THE GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT AND VP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird lands on the ground. It pecks at something, then t head stays up and another head pecks at the ground. It tu and we see that it has two heads. It squawks and flies off.... A SCHOOL BUS makes its way down the street. Singing can b heard from the kids inside. Pan up to reveal “Frighton Elementary” on the side of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (singing) The neck bone’s connected to the: head bone. The head bone’s connected to the: horn bone. The horn bone’s right above the...wing bones. (laughing) The bus pulls into a parking lot. The bus doors open and a THIRD GRADE CLASS OF MONSTER KID pour through, pushing and yelling and laughing and being generally chaotic.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: I scared you!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: (laughing) No you didn't!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Okay, remember our field trip rules everyone: No pushing, no biting, and no fire-breathing. One of the kids breathes fire on one of his friends.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE STUDENT
dialogues.text: (breathing fire)

dialogues.speaker: RAHR
dialogues.text: A TEACHER MONSTER, MRS. GRAVES, stands over him, giving stern look.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: What did I just say? (sigh) 18, 19...? Okay, we’re missing one. Who are we missing? ON THE CLOSED BUS DOORS. A little green hand knocks on the windowed doors. ON MRS. GRAVES. MRS. GRAVES (CONT’D) (realizing - this isn’t the first time...) Oooh, Mike Wazowski. The bus doors open revealing a very tiny, 8-year-old Mike Wazowski, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Thanks Joe! Good luck finishing your crossword puzzle!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Sorry, Michael! I didn’t see you. Mrs. Graves approaches and Mike jumps down. When Mike hit the ground, we see how much bigger all the other kids are

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: That’s okay. When I was on the bus, I found a nickel! Mike walks away, holding the nickel.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sotto) I wish I had pockets....

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Okay, everyone, partner up. Get your field trip buddy! ON MIKE as he tries to buddy with the kids who all happen be bigger than him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Jeremy? You and me? Okay, no biggie. Haley? No? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pairing up with Claire? Great choice, she’s a good egg. Russell. Mike. Wazowski? We carpool. We're cousins.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, RUSSELL
dialogues.text: (high-fiving) Hey! Phil and Russell head off.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, good catching up! Everyone has paired up, leaving Mike on his own. For a second, Mike’s smile falters. Mrs. Graves approaches and smiles bitter-sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Well, Michael, it looks like it’s you and me again.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: (small laugh) Mrs. Graves takes Mike’s hand. Mike sees the kids walking up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to his teacher) C’mon Karen, we're falling behind. Mike tugs on Mrs. Graves’ hand, pulling her toward the ot students.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: (laugh) Please don’t call me Karen. As we crane up, REVEAL we’re at Monsters, Incorporated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Graves’s class is met by a monster TOUR GUIDE.

dialogues.speaker: MI TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Now stay close together, we're entering a very dangerous area. The field trip is entering a scare floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the scare floor. The students are in awe as they see the scare floor.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (walla) Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: MI TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: This is where we collect the scream energy to power our whole world. And can anyone tell me whose job it is to go get that scream?

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Scarers!

dialogues.speaker: MI TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: That’s right! Now which one of you can give me the scariest roar?

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (raising hands) Ooh! Ooh! Me! Me! Mike has his hand raised too.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Ooh, sir! Right here, little green guy at 2 o'clock!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Roar!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: No, no, it’s like this! Raahhr!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey guys, watch this one!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, I got a really goo-

dialogues.speaker: RAAAAAOOWRRRRRRRR
dialogues.text: The kids turn around.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Whoa. The entire group of kids is staring at Mike, eyes wide. H is amazed, for the first time all eyes are on him. Then, Mike realizes the kids are actually looking PAST him. Mik turns and his eye goes wide too. A group of SCARERS are walking onto the scare floor - confident, cool, and aweso

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa. One of the scarers approaches the kids. He wears an old, worn-in MU cap.

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: Well, hey there kids! Are you ona tour with your school?

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (cheering) Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Yes, we’re here to learn about scream energy, and what it takes to be a scarer!

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: Well hey, you’re in luck. Because I just happen to be a scarer! I learned everything I know from my school, Monsters University.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: (in awe) Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: It’s the best scaring school there is. Another scarer, sneaks up behind him and takes his hat.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH SCARER
dialogues.text: You wish, Fear Tech’s the best.  The MU scarer snatches his hat back, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: Okay, you guys watch us and tell me which school's the best. Alright? (whispered, he surreptitiously points to his cap) MU is. Employees (Scarers, assistants, can wranglers, etc.) star stream onto the floor. The tour guide ushers Mike and the students to a viewing area. ON MIKE, studying everything on the scare floor. Not watching, he puts a foot past the line.

dialogues.speaker: MI TOUR GUIDE
dialogues.text: Oops. Stop right there. Don’t cross over that safety line, human children are extremely toxic. Mike steps back and watches all the activity, in awe. But just as the doors start to get wheeled onto the floor, th bigger kids push their way to the front, blocking Mike’s view.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (excited walla) Look at that!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Whoa - hey...guys, watch the eye! Ow! Mike pops out from the back of the crowd and falls on his butt, but pops right back up again.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (walla) Whoa! /Wow!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, fellas. How about we do tallest in the back? Mike is desperate to see. He jumps up, ducks down, peeks between legs and sees: -a glimpse of a door being put into the door station. -a glimpse of a door’s light glowing red.  -a glimpse of a scarer warming up, snarling, etc.

dialogues.speaker: MEAN KID
dialogues.text: Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Look, he’s gonna do a real scare!

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (excited walla) Whoa! And then, Mike’s view is blocked completely.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: (sigh)

dialogues.speaker: MEAN KID
dialogues.text: Cool! I wanna be a scarer!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too! Mike gives it one more shot.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: Come on guys, I wanna see!

dialogues.speaker: MEAN KID
dialogues.text: Out of the way, Wazowski, you don’t belong on a scare floor.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: (walla) Whoa! Cool! Mike backs away as his smile fades. Mike looks frustrated, not being able to see. Just then, cart full of scream cans comes toward Mike. He gets an id ON TEACHER. She tries to keep the kids together.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Brian, do not step over the line. One of them points to the scare floor.

dialogues.speaker: EMMET
dialogues.text: Mrs. Graves? Michael went over the line.  Mrs. Graves’ eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: (scream) Michael?! They all see Mike watching the MU scarer as he opens the to the human world and slinks inside. The door starts to close behind him. But not before Mike, moving fast, slips through the door and into the human world too! INT. HUMAN KID’S ROOM - NIGHT Inside the human kid’s room, Mike hides in the shadows as scarer starts his stealthy approach to the kid. The scare is totally unaware that Mike is in the room. Mike’s terrified, but the more he watches the scarer, the more he gets caught up in the excitement and awe of it al The scarer is about to scare when suddenly the kid’s bedr door opens and the parents peep in. Mike is hiding right behind the door, inches away from the humans! The scarer hides too, blending into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: See, I told you he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, I thought I heard something. The parents close the door and the scarer re-emerges, continuing to build his scare. Mike watches the scarer scratch the end of the bed. The kid hears this and rises up in bed. The scarer slides under the side of the bed and then looms up over the kid.

dialogues.speaker: SCREAM
dialogues.text: ON MIKE as he watches. His mouth falls open, in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scream can fills to the top. The MU scarer steps through the door, a satisfied look on face - a solid scare. The door shuts down. And then he stops in his tracks when he realizes there a dozens of people staring at him, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: What? The MU scarer steps aside, revealing Mike smiling, a daze dreamy look in his eye. Mike is swarmed by angry people - his teacher, factory employees, etc.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: What were you thinking?! (walla) This is ridiculous, young man! You coulda got yourself killed, kid! Did you touch anything?! Do you know what could have happened?! Meanwhile, as the scarer who was in the room with Mike do his MU hat, someone comes over and confers with him. The scarer looks over at Mike, putting things together. As the angry walla continues, the MU scarer approaches Mi again, sternly. Mike is still in awe of everything he jus saw.

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER
dialogues.text: That was real dangerous, kid. I didn’t even know you were in there. Mike looks at the scarer, ashamed. And then, the scarer can’t help but smile, realizing something.

dialogues.speaker: MU SCARER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (impressed) Wow, I didn’t even know you were in there.... (laugh) Not bad, kid. He winks and slaps his MU hat on Mike, then crosses away.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GRAVES
dialogues.text: Michael, what do you have to say for yourself? Mike smiles the biggest, happiest smile you’ve ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MIKE
dialogues.text: How do I become a scarer?  10. Push in to a CU of the MU logo. The eye in the “M” looks from right to left and Mike pops from behind it.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Mike uses the “D” in Disney as teeth and frightens the credits off screen. Mike draws on a chalkboard. The chalk flies into the air creates:

dialogues.speaker: TITLE
dialogues.text: Scare cards flash across the screen, with Mike drawing hi own. Mike is studying with stacks of books around him. Mike’s report card, A+, “horrifying.” He bursts through i with a roar! The letters from the card break up and fall into an envel Mike tears it open and he’s ecstatic! He got into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus comes to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: BUS DRIVER
dialogues.text: Monsters University! Anybody getting off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A backpack and a suitcase appear in the aisle. REVEAL MIKE, beaming, brimming with excitement. He turns face everyone on the bus.  11.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (happy sigh) Well everyone, I don’t mean to get emotional but everything in my life has led to this moment. Let it not be just the beginning of my dream, but the beginning of all of our dreams. Gladys, promise me you'll keep auditioning! Marie, Mr. Right is out there somewhere! Phil, keep using the ointment until that thing goes away! I wish you all the best, thank you all so much! No response from the bus crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BUS DRIVER
dialogues.text: (dead pan) I'm welling up with tears, now get off. Unphased, Mike exits the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike leaps down the stairs and gathers his bags. He stares up in awe.... REVEAL MONSTERS UNIVERSITY: The gate, with the campus bey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks onto a campus filled with monster students of shapes and sizes. In the background, the grand, classic architecture of an Ivy League school.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hello. How ya doing? A student on a bicycle whooshes by. Students play monster hackey sack in the quad as another student with several arms posts signs to a lamppost. A student on a skateboard whizzes by as a giant monster s over Mike and moves to catch a frisbee.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (ground shaking vocs) Ah!  12.

dialogues.speaker: FRISBEE MONSTER
dialogues.text: Woo hoo!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (excited laugh) She catches the frisbee and sends it back to her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike walks over a bridge on a small river. He looks down sees more students, swimming into what must be an underwa section of the school. Mike checks his list:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ok, first thing on my list... get registered! A monster in a “Smile Squad” shirt steps up to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: JAY THE RA
dialogues.text: Hey there, freshman! I’m Jay the RA, and I’m here to say that registration is that-a-way!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay Jay! Mike heads toward the registration area.

dialogues.speaker: JAY THE RA
dialogues.text: Have a great first day! Mike steps up to the registration table.

dialogues.speaker: KAY THE RA
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m Kay! Here’s your orientation packet!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thanks Kay!

dialogues.speaker: KAY THE RA
dialogues.text: You can drop your bags off here and get your picture taken with Trey! Kay motions toward Trey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sits down to get his photo taken.

dialogues.speaker: TREY THE RA
dialogues.text: Say hooray!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hooray! FLASH! Trey takes the photo. CUT TO an insert of Mike’s I card, the top of his head is the only part in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (is he upset?) I can’t believe it... (thrilled) I'm officially a college student!! He joins a freshmen tour group.

dialogues.speaker: FAY
dialogues.text: Okay everyone, I’m Fay and I'll be giving you your orientation tour on this perfect day! The TOUR GUIDE waves her flag. Mike is in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tour continues.

dialogues.speaker: FAY
dialogues.text: Here are the labs where students learn to design and build the doors to the human world. We see a door being processed.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (tour walla) Wow... A Professor swipes their I.D. and enters the work area.

dialogues.speaker: FAY
dialogues.text: Looks like the professor’s about to test a door. A door is activated, and Mike catches a glimpse of a chil bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tour guide leads Mike and the other freshmen through cafeteria.

dialogues.speaker: FAY
dialogues.text: The MU cafeteria serves a full buffet, three meals a day. I personally believe we have some of the best chefs in the world. We see a student dump food into a trash can. A food worke then picks up the trash can and dumps it back onto the buffet.

dialogues.speaker: FAY
dialogues.text: The campus offers a wide variety of majors but the crown jewel of MU is the scaring school.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (walla, in awe) Whoa! The tour guide leads her tour away, leaving Mike alone in of this famous building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike passes by a series of tables, each one manned by students trying to interest freshmen in their respective clubs. The Debate Team.

dialogues.speaker: DEBATE MEMBER
dialogues.text: Welcome to the debate team. We're happy to have you!

dialogues.speaker: DEBATE MEMBER
dialogues.text: I disagree for the following reasons. True happiness is a theoretical construct....  15. Mike continues to walk by the tables and an eye appears behind him. He turns and he is eye to eye with another monster.

dialogues.speaker: EYE MONSTER
dialogues.text: Hey there! Keep your eye on the sky...at the astronomy club. The Art Club. A mop-looking monster splashes pink paint over his head, covering himself. He then splatters his head on a canvas, creating “art” while another member begins to play the dr The Improv Club.

dialogues.speaker: IMPROV STUDENT
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey! Come join the Improv Club! You'll wish you were a...never...always. Ah, dang it! Mike passes by with a smile - he’s not interested, but lo the variety of options, the huge world he’s entered. GREEK COUNCIL table.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: MU’s Greek Council. Yet again, not for Mike. Until, just as he passes by... GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT (CONT’D) We sponsor the annual Scare Games.... That gets Mike’s attention. He stops--

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (stumbling) The Scare-what-now? The Goth Greek Council president and the jock Greek Counc vice president pass Mike a flyer featuring the games.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: (explosive energy) The Scare Games: a super-intense scaring competition!  16.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: (ominous, calm) They’re crazy-dangerous, so anything could happen.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: (explosive energy) A bunch of guys went to the hospital last year!

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: (ominous, calm) You could totally die.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: (explosive energy) And it’s worth it! You get a chance to prove that you are the best! Mike stares down at the flyer, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RA hands Mike a key.

dialogues.speaker: RA
dialogues.text: Wazowski, room three nineteen; you know your roommate is a scaring major too. Excited, Mike grabs his keys from the RA and excitedly he off toward his room.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hello, I’m your roommate. No, that’s too bland. (exhale) Don’t force it. Just let it happen. Your lifelong best friend is right behind this door! (deep breath) Mike swings open the door and the monster in his room is. RANDY BOGGS. Randy is hidden in the shadows, then leaps forward with a friendly hand outstretched.  17.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Hey there! I’m your roomie. Name’s Randy Boggs, scaring major!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (small laugh) Mike Wazowski, scaring major.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I can tell we’re gonna be best chums, Mike. Take whichever bed you want - I wanted you to have first dibs! A student behind Randy drops some boxes. He disappears.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (startled voc) Ah! Randy reappears.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (gasp) You just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Sorry. (growing increasingly agitated) If I do that in scaring class, I’1l be a joke!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No, it’s totally great, you gotta use it.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, but lose the glasses - they give it away. Mike heads into the room. Randy takes off his glasses and squints, looking unintentionally evil.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Huh.... (squinting voc) Randy closes the door.  18. INT. MIKE AND RANDY’S DORM ROOM Mike finishes putting the last of his many scaring poster up, placing books on a shelf, along with Little Mikey and pinning up the Scare Games flyer. He then consults his checklist.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, unpack - check. Hang posters - check. Now I just need to ace my classes, graduate with honors, and become the greatest scarer ever.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Boy, I wish I had your confidence, Mike. Aren't you even a little nervous?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Actually, no. I’ve been waiting for this my whole life. Mike holds the MU hat he got from the scarer when he was kid. He walks toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just can’t wait to get started. We see the scare school in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the campus, as students make their way class. GONG! The bells in the campanile sound the hour, signalli the start of the day. A slug student realizes he’s late.

dialogues.speaker: SLUG
dialogues.text: Oh man! I can’t be late on the first day! He pumps his arms furiously but doesn’t get very far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Randy head into the School of Scaring with the o students. Students touch a statue as they pass by - an MU superstit Mike has to jump up a little to reach it, but he touches statue too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike takes in the enormous rotunda-style classroom.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wow. Busts of distinguished scare professors and alumni sit on pedestals near the windows. In front of each one is a scr can. Mike takes a seat, much bigger monsters on either side of him. A couple of them look down at Mike, amused.

dialogues.speaker: BIG STUDENT
dialogues.text: (chuckle)

dialogues.speaker: BIG STUDENT
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me.... Randy sits next to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I’m so nervous....

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Relax, it’ll be fine. A large, tough, drill sergeant monster, PROFESSOR KNIGHT, addresses the class.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Good morning students, welcome to scaring 101, I am Professor Knight! Now, I’m sure all of you were the scariest monster in your town, well bad news kids, you’re in my town now, and I do not scare easily--- (short scream) Suddenly a beam of light falls over Professor Knight.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (gasps )  20. He stops and looks up to a now empty window. A shape flie around the room, closing the curtains and lands with a clatter behind him. STUDENTS (CONT’D) (walla) Dean Hardscrabble/That'’s really her. The class watches as a form steps out from the light revealing a tall dragon woman with large bat wings, DEAN HARDSCRABBLE.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Dean Hardscrabble. This is a pleasant surprise. ON Mike watching Hardscrabble heading across the room, he chilling insect legs tapping against the floor. Mike’s sm brightens.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (whispered to Randy) She’s a legend; she broke the all time scare record with the scream in that very can. ON HARDSCRABBLE. She adjusts her scream can slightly.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to interrupt, I just thought I’d drop by to see the “terrifying” faces joining my program.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (murmur )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sure my students would love to hear a few words of inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: (addressing Knight) Inspiration? Very well. She addresses the class.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Scariness is the true measure of a monster. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you’re not scary, what kind of monster are you? It’s my job to make great students greater, not make mediocre students LESS mediocre. The class remains nervous.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is why at the end of the semester there will be a final exam. Fail that exam, and you are out of the scaring program. The class reacts.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (gasps ) What? ON MIKE, he looks nervous. ON HARDSCRABBLE.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: So, I should hope you’re all properly “inspired.” The Dean flies out of the top of the building. The class in shock.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (walla) PROFESSOR KNIGHT, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, who can tell me the properties of an effective roar? There is a beat, everyone is terrified, then... a familia green arm shoots up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (catches his breath) There are actually five. Those include the roar’s resonance, the duration of the roar, and the s-  22.

dialogues.speaker: RHAARRRR
dialogues.text: A booming roar stops Mike mid-sentence, blowing everyone the room away. REVEAL a dishevelled 18-year-old SULLEY, stumbling into class, late.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoops, sorry. I heard someone say roar, so I just kinda went for it.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (chuckling, impressed) Sulley starts to slide down the row of students, trying n to squish people as he goes by.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (getting by student) Whoops, excuse me, sorry... didn’t mean to scare you there... (to students) Hey, how ya doin’.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Very impressive, Mr...

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (to the Professor) Sullivan. Jimmy Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Sullivan? Like Bill Sullivan, the scarer?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s my dad.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (impressed walla) No way, whoa!

dialogues.speaker: BIG STUDENT
dialogues.text: He’s a Sullivan....

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: I should've known. I expect big things from you. Sulley reaches his seat and looks back to the professor confidently.  23.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Well, you won’t be disappointed. Mike interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Uh, I’m sorry, should I keep going?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: No, no, Mr. Sullivan’s covered it. Sulley shoots two finger pistols at the Professor. PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) (laugh) Everyone take out your scaring textbooks and open them to chapter one.... Mike sits down, his moment stolen.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Hey bub. Could I borrow a pencil? I forgot all my stuff. A student hands Sulley a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (picking his teeth) Yeah, there we go...that’1ll get it. Mike is annoyed. INT. MIKE AND RANDY’S ROOM Mike pins up his calendar, covering the Scare Games flyer

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Come on Mike- it’s a fraternity and sorority party. We have to go! Mike flips to December and marks the date for the scaring final.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We flunk that scaring final, we are done. I’m not taking any chances. Mike goes back to September and crosses out the first day school.  24.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: We've got the whole semester to study, but this might be our only chance to get in good with the cool kids. That’s why I made these cupcakes. Randy holds up cupcakes that say spell out “BE MY dAL.” Randy notices the mistake then turns the cupcake to read “PAL.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oops. That could have been embarrassing. Mike is too excited about studying to party.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: When I’m a scarer, life will be a nonstop party. Stay outta trouble, wild man! Randy giggles and heads out, closing the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (giggling) Wild man... Mike laughs to himself. He gets to work, opening his scaring book. A strange noise draws his attention to the window. He loo back to the window when a strange pig-faced monster anima suddenly pops up and stares him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What the-? Suddenly the pig is pushed through the window and into Mi room.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah! The pig starts running all over the room. Then a big blue hand rises into view and grabs the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (pulling up efforts)

dialogues.speaker: AH
dialogues.text: With a grunt, Sulley falls into the room. Sulley lands with a thud on the floor. The pig runs over stomach and underneath the bed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey! What are you--

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Shh, shh, shh, shh. Sulley ducks down under the window. Mike hops down from t chair. Mike is shocked that he’s been shushed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait, you’re shushing me?! Hey, hey, you can’t-- Sulley puts a hand to Mike’s mouth, silencing him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (fingers in his mouth) --shushme. Sulley looks out the window. SULLEY’S POV: FOUR BIG FEAR TECH MONSTERS (in letterman jackets) run by, scanning the campus.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH MONSTER
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH MONSTER
dialogues.text: He’s dead meat!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH MONSTER
dialogues.text: That guy's in big trouble!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH MONSTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, he is.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR TECH MONSTER
dialogues.text: Hey guys, over here! ON SULLEY who waits until they’re out of sight, then laug  26.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Fear Tech dummies.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (muffled) Unghhhr! ! REVEAL Mike, Sulley’s hand still clamped over his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry about that, buddy. Sulley releases Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (gasping) Why are you in my room?! Sulley looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Your room? This is my...this is not my room. (then) Archie? Come here, boy!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Archie? Sulley kneels down trying to grab Archie from under the b

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Archie the Scare Pig, he’s Fear Tech’s mascot.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Why is it here?!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) I stole it! Gonna take it to the RORs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (bragging) Roar Omega Roar? THE top fraternity on campus? They only accept the “highly elite.” (bragging) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, I’1l lift the bed, you grab the pig. Ready?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What? No, no, ah....

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (fast) One, two, three! Sulley lifts the bed with one hand and shoves Mike under the other. The bed bumps and bucks as Archie and Mike struggle underneath.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t let go! Careful, he’s a biter! A CHOMP sound.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (pained) Ahhh! Suddenly Archie darts from under the bed, yanking a batte Mike behind him. Archie jumps on Sulley and runs all over him. Sulley falls as Archie leaps to the bookcase. Sulley climbs Mike’s bookshelf to get Archie.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: I got ‘em. The bookshelf comes crashing down, everything falling ont Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Whoa! (falling then laughing) That was awesome! What am I doing? James P. Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Mike Wazowski. Mike tries to show Sulley to the door.  28.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, it was quite delightful meeting you and whatever that is, but if you don’t mind I have to study my scaring!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Pssh, you don’t need to study scaring, you just do it.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Really? I think there’s a little more to it than that. But hey, thanks for stopping by--- Archie jumps down off the desk with Mike’s “MU” hat in hi mouth.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Archie) Ah! Let go of that! Mike lunges for Archie, but Archie leaps out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My hat!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: My pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley dashes out of the dorm first, slamming the door in Mike’s face. The chase continues....

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, come here- (laugh)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (running efforts) Hey! Catch it....Come back here! Sulley is having a blast. Mike leaps on to Archie, but Archie keeps running, now with Mike on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah! Ride it to Frat Row!  29. ON Mike as he tries desperately to steer Archie through campus. ON a portentous monster who is playing guitar for a group girls.

dialogues.speaker: GUITAR MONSTER
dialogues.text: Tentacles and serpents' wings they-- Mike and Sulley burst through disrupting the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RUSH WEEK. Archie runs toward frat row with Mike still on his back. Sulley follows.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (riding vocs) WHOOOAAAA...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (breaths ) wow! Archie runs right through a fraternity house party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley head into the party and barrel through. A student hangs from the ceiling, having a great time.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: (swinging vocs) Woo hoo! Mike is barely hanging on to Archie as he runs through a living room. They enter a game room, Mike tumbles across table and lands right back onto Archie. Sulley jumps over the table but crushes it and grabs a pi of pizza on his way. Mike comes out of the party and runs right into Randy, wh holding out cupcakes.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Cupcake?  30.

dialogues.speaker: ACH
dialogues.text: The cupcakes rain down on Randy's head. Sulley runs past jumps over a railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike rides Archie through a dance party. He collides with a guy playing football and falls off the pig.

dialogues.speaker: FOOTBALL STUDENT
dialogues.text: (impact voc) Hey! Sulley leaps over Mike as he's down and continues after Archie. Mike sees a trash can at the end of a line of bikes. He grabs the football and aims for the bikes.... Sulley almost reaches Archie and dives for him, but misse The bikes fall over like dominoes, knocking the trash can rolling it around just in time to catch Archie as he runs

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Got it! Mike picks up the pig and grabs the hat, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ha ha! (being picked up vocs) Woohoo! Just then, Sulley grabs both of them and hoists them into air, like a trophy.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Fear Tech’s mascot! MU rules!! Cheers erupt as MU students notice Mike and Sulley with Archie.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: (walla) Yeah!  31. Sulley puts Mike down and the crowd surrounds them, congratulating them. Mike grabs his hat. Sulley hands the pig to a group of students who slap a “MU” sticker over h Fear Tech saddle. For Mike, who was annoyed to be on this wild pig chase, t adulation of the crowd changes things. He soaks it up, happily surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chanting)

dialogues.speaker: MU
dialogues.text: The JOX, and another fraternity approach the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: BIG RED
dialogues.text: Did you see him catch that pig?! You are Jaws Theta Chi material, freshman!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, thanks, I didn’t know the-- The fraternity brothers walk right past Mike to Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: No, no, no, he’s an Omega Howl guy.

dialogues.speaker: BIG RED
dialogues.text: Back off, we saw him first.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BROTHER
dialogues.text: No way, we did! Mike notices they’re fighting over Sulley, when suddenly voice calls out. JOHNNY O.S. I'll take it from here, gentlemen! Everyone turns to see a huge monster with large horns and protruding lower jaw flanked with terrifying fangs: JOHNN He steps forward parting the crowd. Johnny and his gang w letterman jackets that read “ROR.”

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (sotto, impressed) The RORs... Johnny approaches Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Worthington, president of Roar Omega Roar. What’s your name Big Blue? The other fraternities slink away.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Jimmy Sullivan, friends call me Sulley. Sulley reacts pleasantly surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: This guy’s a SULLIVAN! Like the famous Sullivan! I can’t believe it! That is crazy.... (laugh)

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (dead pan) Chet, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: (cowering) I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Sulley, any freshman with the guts to pull off a stunt like that has got “future scarer” written all over him. Sulley’s swept toward the ROR house, following after and the ROR brothers. Mike follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (chuckle, wanting to join in) Hey, did you see me ride the pig, that took guts.... Mike is stopped by one of Johnny’s thugs.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: Slow down Squirt, this party is for scare students only. Johnny leans down to Mike’s level. Johnny, 32.  33.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry Killer, but you might want to hang out with someone a little more your speed. They look fun! Johnny points to Oozma Kappa; a group of loser monsters standing by a table that says Oozma Kappa. It’s covered w balloons and cake.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Oh hey ‘dere! Wanna join Oozma Kappa?!

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: We have cake! A monster eats the entire cake in one bite. A balloon deflates and lands on Squishy’s face.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (condescending) Go crazy. Johnny starts to walk away.... Mike is stunned. He can’t be serious.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Is that a joke? Johnny stops, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (annoyed sigh) Sulley, talk to your friend. Johnny looks to Sulley with a pained smile. Sulley looks back and forth between the cool RORs and Mik

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (to Johnny) Well, he’s not really my friend, but sure... (to Mike) You heard him, this is a party for scare students.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I AM a scare student!  34.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: I mean, for scare students who actually, you know, have a chance. Burn, the ROR brothers laugh. This stops Mike, his eye narrows.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: AH, snap!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: My chances are just as good as yours. Sulley get’s embarrassed, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: You're not even in the same league with me.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Just wait hot shot, I'm gonna scare circles around you this year. Sulley looks surprised, and a little embarrassed to be ca out in front of the RORs, but he laughs it off.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Okay, I’d like to see that.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Oh don’t worry... (to himself putting his hat on and walking away) You will. In the BG, the RORs put their arms around Sulley and ushe him into the fraternity house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students are standing around Professor Knight.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Ready position. Common crouch. They quickly show the pose. The professor makes adjustmen  35. PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) I wanna see matted fur, and yellowed teeth! Moving onto the next pose... PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) Basic snarl. Drill sergeant, making them the best they can be.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: (growl)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Show me some slobber!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (growl)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Drool is a tool, kids! Use it!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (growl) He surveys the students and comes to Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Now here is a monster who looks like a scarer! Mike looks over to Sulley....Sulley looks back, points fi pistols at Mike. Mike, frustrated, turns back into the position with even gusto. PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) You want a hope of passing this class, you better eat, breathe and sleep scaring.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON MIKE updating his calendar. In September, he marks out his second day of class.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike pulls a book off the shelf and adds it to a stack of books he is carrying. He grabs another book as he keeps walking. He climbs a ladder to grab a book on the top shelf and ad it to his very tall stack. He grabs another book out from under a sleeping student. Mike studies away in the library, memorizing the differen scares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike practicing his scare faces in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (Roar) He pulls out his retainer to make his face more scary.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Roar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley is in the library and he finds a “Scaring Fundamentals” book. But he uses the book to steady a ping pong table. It’s ready to play on now. Sulley bounces a ball, beer-pong style. He bounces it int the mouth of a sleeping monster with a tic-tac-toe grid o his chest. Sulley’s ball wins the game.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY'S FRIENDS
dialogues.text: (walla) Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cut to Mike tossing a ball over his head as Randy quiz him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Gimme another one....

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fear of spiders?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Arachnophobia.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fear of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Keraunophobia.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Fear of chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Consecotaleophobia. What is this, kindergarten? Give me a hard one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the field, the MU team scores a touchdown. Monster cheerleaders start to cheer, the MU band strikes up.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADERS
dialogues.text: (cheering)

dialogues.speaker: DO
dialogues.text: A player catches a football, then a bigger player picks h up, then a GIANT player picks them up and runs through th field trampling every player. Pandemonium in the stands. Sulley and his ROR friends CHE PAN DOWN to Mike and Randy in the stands. Mike studies hi scaring textbook, oblivious to the game and cheering arou him. A drink falls on Mike and he looks up from his book. But then goes back to his book as the crowd cheers again. Wipe cut: October calendar page. 37.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Professor lists multiple choice answers on the chalkboard.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: The answer is C, fangs!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Well done, Mr. Wazowski.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A bowl of spiders.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Correct!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: A clown running in the dark!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Right again!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Warts, boils and moles, in that order.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Outstanding! Sulley looks over at Mike annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley are next to each other on the treadmills. They start to compete with each other. Mike speeds up so Sulley speeds up too. But it is too much for him and he falls off the treadmill. Mike laughs but then falls off too, spinning and then fly off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley walks down the stairs toward Johnny holding his ex results. Sulley gives Johnny a high five. Johnny puts his arm around Sulley encouragingly until Mike rushes down th stairs and reveals his “A+” exam and runs off.  39. A ROR brother grabs the exam out of Sulley’s hands and sh Johnny he got a “C-.” Sulley grabs it back and walks away “no big deal.” Johnny and the RORs exchange concerned looks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The calendar shows November is almost over....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a work-study timecard for Michael Wazowski. Mike pulls it out and punches in. Mike is studying again as he buffs the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (practice roars) Monsters have to jump out of the way as he drives by beca he is not paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: ah (leaping out of the way)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike runs over several monsters, but is so focused on his book he doesn’t notice. Monsters continue walking past and one slips on the slick floor. He runs over more monsters as he practices scary faces.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (practice roars)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike demonstrating the different scares for the professor

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (Roar for each scare, soft)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Ogre’s slump.  40.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (Roar for each scare, soft)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Zombie snarl.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (Roar for each scare, soft)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Dominant silverback gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (Roars for each scare, soft) The professor is thoroughly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: That is some remarkable improvement, Michael. Sulley attempts to make a scare face.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (Roar voc)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: One frightening face does not a scarer make, Mr. Sullivan. Sulley looks over at Mike, disappointed in himself. Mike smiles at Sulley and points finger pistols at him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The scare final is coming up. Mike looks at his calendar circles the date in red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Randy approach the School of Scaring, nervous bu determined. They quiz each other on the way.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (in the background) A Townson grimace with extra slobber.  41.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: You got it!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That's what I’m sayin’! Sulley scowls as he watches from afar with the RORs.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (to the RORs) I’m gonna wipe the floor with that little know-it-all. Johnny puts his arm on Sulley’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Yes you are, Big Blue. Johnny removes Sulley’s ROR jacket. Sulley’s confused.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, wait, what are you-?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: It’s just a precaution. RORs are the best scarers on campus, Sullivan. Can’t have a member getting shown up by a beach ball. Johnny and Sulley look toward Mike as he enters the Schoo Scaring.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: (in the background) Whoa! Amazing...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (laugh) Woo-hoo, I am on a roll! ON Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna destroy that guy!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (re: jacket) Well, then you'll get this back right away. It’s time to start delivering on that Sullivan name. Sulley’s face drops. He tries to put on a confident face, but we can see it’s a struggle.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Knight addresses the class for their final.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Today’s final will judge your ability to assess a child’s fear, and perform the appropriate scare...in the scare simulator. ON THE SIMULATOR - a simulated human child’s bedroom, complete with robotic child, much more low tech then we’1 see in Monsters, Inc. ON THE STUDENTS - staring at the simulator, nervous. ON KNIGHT - lifting the settings on the simulator to medi PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) The child’s sensitivity level will be raised from bed-wetter to heavy sleeper. So give it everything you've got. He closes and locks a control box at the bottom of the be and turns to the class. PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) Dean Hardscrabble is with us this morning to see who will be moving on in the scaring program, and who will not. He gestures to Hardscrabble standing off to the side. ON SULLEY watching Hardscrabble, fear setting in. Hardscrabble casually dusts her record-breaking scream ca she moves to the front of the class. Mike and Randy look over to Hardscrabble, fear setting in PROFESSOR KNIGHT (CONT’D) Let’s get started!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous student stands on stage by the simulator, waiti for his exam to start.  43.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: I am a 5-year-old girl afraid of spiders and Santa Claus. Which scare do you use? Dean Hardscrabble flies from the floor up to the window. student trying out can’t help notice.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT TRYING OUT
dialogues.text: Uh, that’s a seasonal creep and crawl.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Demonstrate. The student walks through the door to the simulator and lunges, roaring at the sim kid.

dialogues.speaker: ROAR
dialogues.text: The student looks to Professor Knight.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR KNIGHT
dialogues.text: Results will be posted outside my office. Next! The next student steps up. ON MIKE who forces himself to stop watching the tests.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (to himself) Focus. Mike pulls out his textbook and does some last-minute cramming.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (exhale) Johnson crackle and howl. (checks the book) Yes! (laugh) Mike continues to study. REVEAL SULLEY watching Mike, resentful - that confident little guy is the first person to ever make him second-gu his scaring abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley turns to see Johnny and the RORs enter and sit in stands. Johnny looks to Sulley. Sulley turns back to Mike confidently, but it’s all for s Mike has gotten under his skin. ON Mike as Sulley walks by and “accidentally” bumps Mike’ books off the wall. Mike glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, do you mind?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t mind at all. Sulley starts warming up, obnoxiously, right by Mike.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Roar! Grri!! Arr! Mike shoots daggers at Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: C’mon Mike, let’s just move. Mike jumps down near Sulley and picks up his books.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Stay outta my way. Unlike you, I had to work hard to get into the scare program.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: That’s because you don’t belong here.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (beat) Rahr! Sulley is surprised but he roars back.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Roar! (laugh, to himself) That’s what I thought.... Sulley goes back to practicing as Mike’s cocky smile melt His words have gotten under Mike’s skin.  45.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (quietly) Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Mike gets into Sulley’s face and starts practicing his sc too.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (quietly) Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Roar! Sulley keeps doing the same scare move. With every lunge, Mike does a different move. Other students start to take notice of the guys. Randy looks up at Hardscrabble, concerned. He sees that Hardscrabble is taking notice.... Mike and Sulley get closer and closer to one another and Sulley steps back, tripping on the books.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (stumbling back vocs) Whoa- Sulley stumbles back and bumps into the stand holding Hardscrabble’s scream can. It starts wobbling.... The can wobbles strongly then falls. There's a beat - then it appears to be undamaged. Whew- they’re safe. Suddenly, the scream is released, sending the can spinnin around the room! Students have to duck out of the way as flies back and forth. It finally lands in front of Mike and Sulley, emptying completely. Suddenly a huge, dark figure lands in front of them, wing outstretched. Mike and Sulley come face to face with Dean Hardscrabble. She picks up her empty scream can. Randy looks from Mike and Sulley to Hardscrabble, then bl himself invisible.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.  46.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: What, this? My one souvenir from a lifetime of scaring? Accidents happen don’t they? The important thing is: no one got hurt.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You're taking this remarkably well.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Now, let’s continue the exams. (to Mike) Mr. Wazowski, I’m a 5-year-old girl on a farm in Kansas afraid of lightning. Which scare do you use? Mike looks around confused, why is she taking over?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t I go up on the--

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: (leaning in) Which scare do you use?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That is a shadow approach with a crackle holler.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Demonstrate. Mike moves through the steps of the scare deliberately. He takes a deep breath, preparing to scare when:

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop! Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But I didn’t get to sh--

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: I’ve seen enough. Hardscrabble turns to Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m a 7-year-old boy--  47. Sulley steps forward and ROARS ferociously. Hardscrabble unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t finished.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t need to know any of that stuff to scare.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: That "stuff" would have informed you that this particular child is afraid of snakes. So a roar wouldn’t make him scream, it would make him cry, alerting his parents, exposing the monster world, destroying life as we know it, and of course, we can’t have that, so I’m afraid I can not recommend that you continue in the scaring program, good day.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing, then it dawns on him) Wait, what? But I’m a Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Well then, I’m sure your family will be very disappointed. Sulley is incredulous, confused. He looks up into the stands, just in time to see the door swing shut on Johnny the RORs as they exit. Sulley can’t believe this is happening. He turns to Mike and stares at him with pure hate and the marches off. Mike watches Sulley leave, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Mr. Wazowski, what you lack is something that cannot be taught, you're not scary. Mike stands there, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not be continuing in the scaring program.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please, let me try the simulator, I'll surprise you.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Surprise me? I doubt that very much. SMASH TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time lapse: Barely any leaves are on the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A BORING PROFESSOR, Professor Brandywine. REVEAL Mike sitting in class, pained to be there. He stares out the window at the School of Scaring in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR BRANDYWINE
dialogues.text: Welcome back, I hope everyone had a pleasant break. Some say that a career as a scream can designer is boring, unchallenging, a waste of a monster's potential.... Beat. PROFESSOR BRANDYWINE (CONT’D) (inhale) Open your textbooks to chapter three. We will now plunge into the rich history of scream can design. Mike looks over to Sulley who is glaring at him. Sulley squeezes his scream can in frustration at Mike, and Mike glares back at him. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike emerges from class, dejected. He heads toward his do We pull out and reveal that Sulley is walking next to him still glaring....Mike pays no attention. Sulley stops and watches Mike walk off ahead of him. INT. MIKE’S DORM ROOM Mike slowly walks into his room, depressed, shutting the world out. He stands by his bed and stares at his MU hat, then looks the window at the School of Scaring across the quad. His heart breaks. He looks down at his lame scream can tech book. His frustration boils and he throws the book against the wall The book knocks down his calendar revealing the Scare Gam poster. Mike’s brow raises and a smile slowly grows acros his face. He quickly tears the poster off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike opens his door and Sulley is standing there, still glaring. Mike smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (excited breaths) Out of my way! Mike rushes down the hall with his poster, determined!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coming through! (bumping into a student) Oops, sorry! Ha ha! Sulley stares at Mike, what’s gotten into him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greek Scare Games kickoff. Fraternity and sorority monsters have gathered for the ev The Greek Council president and VP are on stage to addres the crowd.  50.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Welcome to this year’s Greek Scare Games kickoff! The over-excited vice president leans into his mic and ye to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Okay, relax. We have a special guest, the founder of the Games - Dean Hardscrabble! More cheers as Dean Hardscrabble steps to the podium.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. As a student I created these games as a friendly competition. But be prepared: To take home the trophy you must be the most fearsome monsters on campus. Instantly posing, a student photographer snaps a picture the RORs.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So good luck, and may the best monsters win! Hardscrabble leaves the stage.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: Alright everybody, we’re closing down sign-ups, so we’ll see you all-

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Wait! Mike pushes through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm signing up. The crowd, especially the RORs, bust out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (laughing) What?! ON PROFESSOR HARDSCRABBLE who narrows her eyes. What’s Wazowski up to?  51. Sulley shows up, still angry, looking for Mike.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Uhhh, you have to be ina fraternity to compete.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Behold, the next winning fraternity of the Scare Games... the brothers, my brothers, of Oozma Kappa! Mike points, revealing the members of the misfit fraterni Don, Terri and Terry, Squishy, and Art. They’re not used having so many eyes on them, but they stand proud.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Hi. A balloon deflates on Squishy’s head. The crowd snickers. Hardscrabble approaches Mike.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Mr. Wazowski, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You just said the winners are the most fearsome monsters on campus. If I win, it means you kicked out the best scarer in the whole school.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: That won’t happen.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How about a little wager?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (shocked gasp)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If I win, you let me back in the scaring program.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes) Pfft...

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: And what would that prove?  52.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That you were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: (shocked laughs)

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Very well, if you win I will let your entire team into the scare program, but if you lose, you will leave Monsters University. Mike struggles with this and then...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: (smiling) Now all you need to do is find enough members to compete. Mike turns to the misfits.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We need six guys, right?

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: Sorry chief, we count bodies, not heads. (pointing to Terri and Terry) That dude counts as one. Terri and Terry look at each other. Mike’s in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (frantic) Anybody else wanna join our team?! Anyone at all?

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Sorry, I’m late. Can I just squeeze by- Mike suddenly spots Randy in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Randy! Randy, thank goodness, I need you on my team!  53.

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: Oh sorry, I’m already on a team. Johnny calls over, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Boggs! Randy looks conflicted, nervous. He reveals his fraternit affiliation....

dialogues.speaker: RANDY
dialogues.text: I'm finally in with the cool kids Mike, DON’T blow this for me! He crosses to stand near the RORs.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Do the thing. With a pained smile - Randy’s thrilled to be a ROR, but i exactly one of the guys - Randy camouflages. Pleased, Joh chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: CHET
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) Oh, where did he go? (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: ROR BROTHERS
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Please anybody! I need one more monster. Just one more! ON PRESIDENT.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: (to Mike) Yeah sorry, doesn’t look good. We have to move on. Your team doesn’t qualify.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yes it does. Sulley climbs on the car that Mike is standing on.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The star player has just arrived. Mike’s eye goes wide.  54.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No way! (to the crowd) Someone else, please anyone else!

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: We’re shutting down sign-ups, okay. Is he on your team or not? Sulley smiles at Mike, cocky.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD MEMBER
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (steaming) Fine! Yes, he’s on my team. Hardscrabble smiles a chilling smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Good luck. Hardscrabble walks off.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Alright Wazowski, what’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: OOZMA KAPPA FRATERNITY HOUSE, a quaint little hou ON Sulley and Mike looking confused by this place.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: This is a fraternity house? The door swings open, revealing DON CARLTON.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Hey there, teammateys! Come on aboard! INT. OOZMA KAPPA FRATERNITY HOUSE. Don ushers Sulley and Mike inside.  55.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: As the president of Oozma Kappa, it is my honor to welcome you to your new home! Mike and Sulley step inside a very underwhelming house, w they find their new fraternity brothers waiting.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: We call this room, “Party Central.” It looks like an old lady’s house.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Technically, we haven’t actually had a party here yet.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: But when we do, we’ll be ready. Terri presses a remote and a disco ball drops from the ceiling on a cord. The cord snaps and the disco ball smas onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is mingling.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Whoo! Hot cocoa train is coming through. Whoa...next stop...You! Don hands Mike a drink. Mike begins to address the room.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I would like to start us off first by -

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting) So...you guys are scaring majors? Sulley stands near a cabinet looking at the dainty “old l objects.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (laugh) We were. None of us lasted very long. I guess we just weren’t what old Hardscrabble was looking for. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hands Sulley a business card) .--Don Carlton, “mature” student. Thirty years in the textile industry and then ol’ dandy Don got downsized. Figured I could throw myself a pity party or go back to school and learn the computers. Mike and Sulley turn to the cheery two-headed monster.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hello, I’m Terry with a Y!

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: And I’m Terri with an I. I’ma dance major!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: And I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: 5 6 7 8, do, do, do, do, 7 8, TURN! And turn....why didn’t you turn?

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: (lowered voice) Because we never agreed to do this.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: You said this was gonna be cool.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: No one said this was gonna be cool.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Now I’m embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: NOW you’re embarrassed?

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: Yes, because it’s in front of people.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: You should wake up embarrassed! Next, it’s Art’s turn - big, burly, but with a sensitive

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: (gruff) Hey! I’m Art. New Age Philosophy major. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excited to live with you, and laugh with you, and cry with you. He hands them each a journal.

dialogues.speaker: ART, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thought you might like to keep a dream journal. Suddenly, Squishy pops up right behind Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Guess that leaves me. Squishy gives Sulley a start - where did that little guy from? Squishy walks around in front of Sulley and takes seat.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My name’s Scott Squibbles. My friends call me “Squishy.” I’m undeclared, unattached and... (losing steam) ...unwelcome pretty much everywhere but here. Mike tries to take control again.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well, now that we’ve all been introduced, as captain of our team-

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (interrupting again) So basically you guys have no scaring experience?

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Not a lot! But now we’ve got you!

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: You’re about the scariest feller I've ever seen - even with them pink polka dots.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (blushing, laughing) Aw, thanks. 57. come a  58.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Well actually, I think I bring the whole package-- Squishy grabs Sulley’s hand and holds it up to his face.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Your hands are as big as my face!

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: He’s like a mountain, with fur!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (Awe shucks) Awe come on, I don’t even work out!

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: Yeah, me neither. (to Mike) I don’t wanna get too big. (sniff)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (laughing) We thought our dreams were over, but Mike said if we win, they’re letting us in the scaring program!

dialogues.speaker: TERRI/TERRY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna be real scarers!

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: The best!/Yeah, we are!/You betcha! ON MIKE AND SULLEY as Sulley gives a confused, awkward humoring nod.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (humoring nod) Yeah, right... Sulley looks over to Mike and shoots him a suspicious loo Mike just smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MIKE AND SULLEY’S FRATERNITY ROOM The guys enter a dark room, where Don flips a switch to t on the light.  59.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: And here's what you've been waitin’ for, fellas, your very own Oozma Kappa bedroom. It’s a very small room with bunk beds.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (chuckling, incredulous, as in “this should be interesting”) Ah great, we're sharing this room?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We'll let you guys get settled. Anything you need, you just give a big holleroony! Don shuts the door, leaving Mike and Sulley alone in the together.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks buddy... (quickly to Mike) Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Look, they don’t need to be good. I’m gonna carry the whole team.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Really? And who’s gonna carry you? Mike stares at Sulley, furious.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna go back to can design, you know where the door is. Suddenly, the lights go out in the room. Sulley flicks th switch. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley feel their way through the darkened house

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Guys? Anybody home?  60. Suddenly a door CREAKS open revealing a stairwell leading down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, hello? Fellas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley step down into the basement. One candle i lit in the middle of the room. A ROBED MONSTER (Don) suddenly steps from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Do you pledge your souls to the Oozma Kappa brotherhood?! A robed Terri and Terry step out from the shadows. Terry whacks Mike on the butt with a paddle.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Do you swear to keep secret-—

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: All that you learn here?

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: No matter how horrifying! Squishy whacks Sulley on the butt with a paddle.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Hey! A robed Squishy rises from the shadows, paddle in hand.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Will you take the sacred oath of the S-- Suddenly, a super-bright light comes on, flooding the basement in light. A middle-aged monster mom comes down t stairs carrying a basket of laundry.

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: (bright light reaction) Whoa!/Hey, for crying out loud.  61.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SQUIBBLES
dialogues.text: Sweetie, turn the lights on while you're down here. You're going to ruin your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Mom, we're doing an initiation!

dialogues.speaker: MS. SQUIBBLES
dialogues.text: Oh scary! Well, carry on, just pretend I’m not here.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: This is my mom’s house. Squishy tries to pretend she’s not there.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you promise to look out for your brothers, no matter what the peril.... Ms. Squibbles goes about her business, turning on both th washer and the dryer. The noise gets much louder.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (louder) .-.-will you defend Oozma Kappa, no matter how dangerous, no matter how insurmountable the odds may be? From evils - both great and small - in the face of unending pain and-- (then, giving up) Oh, forget it. You’re in. The brothers of Oozma Kappa crowd around Mike and Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Look, we know we’re no one’s first choice for a fraternity. So it means a lot to have you here with us.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Can't wait to start scaring with you, brothers! Squishy offers them each an Oozma Kappa baseball hat. Mike puts it on then looks to Sulley - is he in or out? A beat, then Sulley reluctantly puts on the hat. It’s way small for his giant head. The fraternity brothers cheer!  62. Terry whacks Sulley on the butt again with the paddle. Sulley snatches the paddle away and snaps it in half. Ter and Terry scurry away. The misfits head off.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time for a celebration! Grab the couch cushions, gentlemen, cuz we're building a fort!

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: (cheering walla) Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: Mom! Can we stay up late tonight?! INT. OOZMA KAPPA, MIKE AND SULLEY’S ROOM - MORNING The sun is just coming up as Mike sleeps in bed. He rolls over, right into a blue furry hand. He cuddles into the h for a beat. PANNING WIDE we see that Sulley’s arm is flopped out of h top bunk. It’s so long it reaches down onto Mike’s bed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (snoring, murmuring) I know you’re a princess and I’m just a stable boy- Mike cuddles TENDERLY with the hand for another moment, t the alarm goes off. His eye opens, and he sees Sulley’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (cuddling noises, then)

dialogues.speaker: ACCHHHH
dialogues.text: He pushes the hand away, flipping a sleeping Sulley out o the top bunk. BAM! Sulley lands on the floor, then pops u angrily.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (impact effort) What?! Mom! (looking to Mike) What are you doing?!  63.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Your grubby paw was in my bed!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (flustered) Were you kissing my hand?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (big laugh) No! And what about you with all your shedding!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t shed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Really? Mike punches the bottom of Sulley’s mattress, and blue ha comes cascading down off the mattress. Sulley tries pushing past Mike, as Mike gets out of bed. Mike tries to go around Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Excuse me-

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (growl) I just wanna get my stuff-

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY MIKE
dialogues.text: (pushing efforts) Would you...just...let me get Ow...-hey, come on..oof! my stuff! Ahhh, ow! They fall out of their bedroom door. Flash! They find all the misfits gathered there in the hallway, smiling at the

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: First morning in the house!

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: That’s going in the album. Don runs up the stairs out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Guys! We got...a letter!

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: A letter? Really?

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: We never get mail.  64. Mike, Sulley, and the misfits gather around. Don hands Mi the letter, Mike tries to take it from Don, but it’s stuc his tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (letter sticking to tentacles vocs) Oh sorry, it’s stuck....

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (grabbing the letter) Would you, gimme that! Mike finally pulls it off of Don and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Tentacles... (laugh) They're sticky... Mike opens the envelope revealing a mysterious letter.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (gasp) It’s the first event of the Scare Games!

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: (walla) Cool! /Alright!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: “A child’s room is where you scare, but avoid the toxicity lurking there.”

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, where do they want us to meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike, Sulley, and the misfits tentatively step into the sewer/drain located on campus. Water drips, graffiti on t wall, spooky.

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: Of all the sewers on campus this one has always been my favorite.  65.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Art, you've been here before?

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: I have a life outside of the house, you know! As they step forward and turn a corner, they hear voices. and then they see: The assembled throng for the first event of the Scare Gam The Greek Council president and VP stand in the center of sewer, on a stage against a wall. All the competing fraternities and sororities are there, gathered around the stage.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: Welcome to your worst nightmare,

dialogues.speaker: THE SCARE GAMES
dialogues.text: (enjoying the excitement) Yeees, yes, I love it! I love this energy! Okay, okay everybody! Mike glances up, noticing Hardscrabble peering in from on high.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Let’s hear it for the frats and sororities competing in this year’s games! Jaws Theta Chi! ON THE JOX TEAM. A collection of big, wide-shouldered joc Big Red, their leader, takes a board and breaks it over h head. GREEK COUNCIL PRESIDENT (CONT’D) Python Nu Kappa! ON THE PNK TEAM. A group of pretty and seemingly friendly female monsters.

dialogues.speaker: GREEK COUNCIL VP
dialogues.text: Slugma Slugma Kappa! ON THE EEK TEAM. A collection of athletic female monsters They cheer in a huddle. GREEK COUNCIL VP (CONT’D) Roar Omega Roar!  66. ON THE RORS. These are the top scarers, wealthy, privileg with the largest fan base.
