dialogues.text: We've got a call in, but that’s the best we can do--- Don taps one of them on the shoulder and they turn around bewildered to see someone has crossed into the lab.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Ahem. (turning on the charm) Don Carton, sales. Folks, today is your lucky day, how many times have you asked yourself the following question-- Hardscrabble stares at Don, not buying it.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Arrest him. Suddenly, two guards throttle Don against the wall.  134.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Pardon? (impact) Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Spread ‘em, Pops!

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Do you mind?!

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Don’t move! Sulley runs for the door. When Sulley’s almost to the door, Hardscrabble spots him of the corner of her eye.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: What? Sullivan! Don't you dare! He grabs the door handle....

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sullivan, don’t go in there! Sulley quickly looks back toward Hardscrabble, ignores he and slips through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley creeps through the cabin, which is empty. Where is Mike?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (whisper) Mike? Mike? Sulley hears voices outside and crosses to a window. Some camp counselors are gathered in front of one of the kids’ cabins, relating the events of the night to some park rangers. The flashing lights of the ranger’s cruiser stro through the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: The kids are saying they saw something in the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: They're calling it an alien.  135.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: It was!

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: I saw a little green guy! Sulley hears a noise and looks over to see a broken scree He goes to the screen and whispers outside....

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (whispered) Mike? He climbs out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulley jumps down from the window. A couple of rangers hear him and train their flashlights him.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (gasp) Ah!

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Bear! A bear in the camp! Sulley takes off running, jumping down into a gully, evad the lights. Sulley sprints through the woods. He bursts through some brush and comes to the edge of a lake. He scans the lake but hears men yelling and ducks behind rack of canoes, seeing flashlights in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS
dialogues.text: (walla) Down there, everybody over here...I heard something over here. Sulley hears a splash and turns to see Mike sitting at th foot of the lake, staring at his reflection in the water.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (gasp then sigh of relief) Mike! Mike doesn’t look back.  136.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon buddy, let’s get you out of here. Mike still doesn’t look up.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is all my fault...I’m sorry--- Mike continues to look down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (depressed) You were right, they weren’t scared of me. Sulley moves closer and looks down at Mike, silent.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I did everything right. I wanted it more than anyone. And I thought, I thought if I wanted it enough, I could show everybody that... Mike stares at his reflection in the water.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That Mike Wazowski is something special, and I’m just...not. He splashes it away.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Look Mike, I know how you feel---

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Don’t do that. Please don’t do that. You DO NOT know how I feel. Mike’s raises his voice, Sulley looks around cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Mike, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Monsters like you have everything. You don’t have to be good, you can mess up over and over again, and the whole world loves you.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Mike-  137.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’1l never know what it’s like to fail, because you were born a Sullivan!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m a Sullivan! I’m the Sullivan who flunked every test, the one who got kicked out of the program. The one who was so afraid to let everyone down, that I cheated, and I lied. (sigh) Mike, I‘11 never know how you feel, but you’re not the only failure here. Sulley’s shoulders drop, he sits down next to Mike.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I act scary Mike, but most of the time...I’m terrified.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: How come you never told me that before?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Because...we weren’t friends before. Mike is stunned, at a loss for words. Suddenly a flashlight grazes Sulley. Sulley jumps back as the lights come toward him. Mike hides behind a rock as he watches Sulley driven away Mike is in shock. Sulley looks back at Mike, they both do know what to do. After a second, Sulley just takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS
dialogues.text: (walla) Over there... Sulley runs through the darkness and right into an EMBANKMENT. He tries to climb the slippery side of the embankment but flashlights are getting closer.  138. Just as he is struggling, a tree limb is suddenly lowered down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley. Sulley looks up - it’s Mike, at the top of the embankment Sulley’s surprised.... In the distance, the sound of humans is getting closer, a we can make out flashlights in the trees. Mike lowers the tree branch a little more, bracing his fe against some rocks. He pulls Sulley up over the edge. They take off back towa the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rangers are surrounding the cabin. Mike and Sulley see an opening and sprint toward the cabi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys burst into the cabin, run to the closet door and throw it open! REVEAL: Just a closet full of camping supplies. No monste world. ON MIKE AND SULLEY, who react, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door powers down. The door lab is crawling with campus security. Dean Hardscrabble stands beside the door station, a finger on power button. Oozma Kappa is being held back by security.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: They're still in there!  139.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Until the authorities arrive, this door stays off. The misfits react. Hardscrabble has just delivered a deat sentence.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: NO! You can’t do that! Squishy breaks the line, tearfully charging for his frien but he’s held back with ease by security.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Enough! I want this room cleared, now! Security starts herding students out of the lab.

dialogues.speaker: MISFITS
dialogues.text: (walla) Hey, you can’t do this!/Please wait, don’t do this now!/He needs our help! The lab doors are slammed shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley are panicked. Mike closes the door, then quickly opens it, but again, nothing. Mike and Sulley hear the humans outside getting closer. They run to the cabin window and see that a group of rang has arrived. They approach the cabin, shining flashlights Sulley runs away.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: We've gotta get out of here. Mike gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (whispered) Let them come!  140.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (whispered) What? Sulley looks at Mike, confused.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: If we scare them, I mean really scare them...we could generate enough scream to power the door from this side.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I have read every book about scaring ever written. This could work!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: They're ADULTS! I can’t do this!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes you can, just follow my lead.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ON THE DOOR to the cabin. The doorknob turns, then ranger pour in, flashlights pointing into the darkness. They jump as a fan turns on suddenly, then slows to a sto The window drapes flutter, as if someone has just touched them. The rangers proceed farther into the cabin. Up in the rafters, Sulley and Mike nod at each other. Mik counts down silently as they get ready for their next act BAM! The front door of the cabin slams shut behind the rangers. The rangers hear music. They spin around and see a record player, playing a record backward. They hear another sound and turn their flashlights on a d walking across the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL
dialogues.text: Ma-ma. Ma-ma. The doll walks into a bed post and falls down.  141.

dialogues.speaker: DOLL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (warbled) Ma-ma. Ma-ma... They see a dark shadow run across the floor behind them. It’s Mike. Sulley reaches down behind the rangers and scrapes the fl with his claws. The rangers turn in time to see the claw marks on the floor. They hear something in the rafters. Shining their flashlights in that direction they see more claw marks on walls all around them. They hear a deep, low growl as something short and round scurries across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (growl)

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: What the-

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS
dialogues.text: (gasp) Whoa! Just before their flashlights reach Mike, Sulley reaches and pulls him up into the rafters again like a basketball

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (walla) I heard it./It’s going this way.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (whispered) Now what?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (whispered) Phase two. Down on the floor, the rangers jump when suddenly the bun beds start to topple over toward them like dominoes. The terrified rangers run to avoid being hit by the beds, which fall on the front door, blocking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardscrabble is alone in the lab. Faint screams are heard and the light above the door sudd flickers red then fades back to black. Hardscrabble stares at the light, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike smiles as he sees the door to the monster world star glow. He turns to Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Mike, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. Stop being a Sullivan, and start being you. Sulley looks uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Call for backup!

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Assistance on the north side. Repeat, we need assistance on the north side. Mike jumps down from the rafters behind the rangers. He grabs a fishing pole and ties some of the line to a table leg. He runs around the room, encircling the rangers.

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS
dialogues.text: (walla) What was it?/Let’s go! The rangers are spooked. From a hiding place behind a piece of furniture, Mike loc eyes with Sulley and nods. It sinks in, Sulley becomes determined. It’s time.  143.

dialogues.speaker: RANGERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (walla, glimpsing Mike rolling by) Over here!/It’s right behind you! Sulley drops from the rafters, landing in front of the rangers. He begins to let out a deep growl.... As the rangers recoil in horror, Mike tightens the fishin line around the ranger’s legs causing them to fall and ge tangled in the line. As the rangers struggle on the floor, Sulley looms over t and lets out a ferocious roar.

dialogues.speaker: ROAR
dialogues.text: The ranger screams are overwhelming....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lab, the screams burst through, flooding the room energy. Everyone outside the lab sees bright lights. Something is going on, but no one can tell what it is. The light above the door turns bright red, followed by th stacks of scream cans across the room filling up complete Hardscrabble, alone in the lab, is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door glows brightly.

dialogues.speaker: ROAR
dialogues.text: ON THE RANGERS, screaming as they run from Mike and Sulle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up of scream cans on a shelf overflowing, exploding some flying through the air. Hardscrabble, standing in front of the cans, doesn’t know what to do -- she looks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike sees that the door is now on.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Sulley, come on! They run for their exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardscrabble sees the door is about to explode and she ju out of the way. Sulley and Mike burst through it in a cloud of smoke and debris. Hardscrabble peeks out from behind several destroyed scre cans. For the first time, Dean Hardscrabble is dumbfounde They all look back at the door, which has been completely destroyed. Mike sees his smoking, tattered MU hat in the rubble. Hardscrabble approaches Mike and Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: How...how did you do this?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t ask me. Sulley looks at Mike. Mike looks unaware. She can’t belie it. Suddenly someone is sawing through the wall and the Child Detection Agency blast through to the lab.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: (walla) Move! Move! Move! This is a 5423 in progress. Alright everybody, clear out! Secure the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: No child breach, repeat: No child breach. The CDA cover the room, inspecting and grabbing Mike and Sulley. The students outside start yelling at Sulley and Mike.  145.

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY STUDENT
dialogues.text: You ruined our doors!

dialogues.speaker: ANGRY STUDENT
dialogues.text: I’ve been working on my door all semester!

dialogues.speaker: CDA AGENT
dialogues.text: Let’s go you two. The misfits emerge from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: You're alive!

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We are so glad you’re safe! As the CDA escort Mike and Sulley out of the room, Hardscrabble stares after them in a daze. She is left standing amongst the scream cans. The misfits yell after them.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hey, wait!

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: What’s gonna happen to them? A familiar CDA agent responds. It’s Roz dressed in CDA clothing.

dialogues.speaker: ROZ
dialogues.text: That's for the University president to decide, but you can be sure we'll be watching these two, always watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON DON looking dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Expelled?! Sulley and Mike are bummed to have to deliver the news.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, we really messed up.  146.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: So...you’re leaving?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, buddy, we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: ART
dialogues.text: Harsh, man.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, guys. You’d be in the scaring program right now if it wasn’t for us. The misfits exchange a look - they clearly have some news

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Well, it is the gosh-darndest thing.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: Hardscrabble’s letting us into the scare program.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: She was impressed with our performance in the games.

dialogues.speaker: TERRI
dialogues.text: She invited us to join next semester!

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) Congratulations, guys!

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: And that’s not the only piece of good news. Sheri and I are engaged! Sulley and Mike are confused.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Oh...who’s Sheri?  147.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: (painfully embarrassed) She’s my mom.... Ms. Squibbles steps up and Don puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: MS. SQUIBBLES
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn’t my two favorite fellas!

dialogues.speaker: DON, MS. SQUIBBLES
dialogues.text: (nuzzling noises) Come here, give me some sugar....

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: So uncomfortable...

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Awe, come on Scott. I don’t want you to think of me as your new dad, after all, we're fraternity brothers first.

dialogues.speaker: SQUISHY
dialogues.text: This is so weird....

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Just think of me as your big brother, that’s marrying your mother. Wait, hold on. We’re brothers who share the same mom, slash wife. That’s worse.... Everyone’s a little grossed out by Don’s words, Don inclu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley stand by their respective suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (somber) Well, I guess we should be going now.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (getting emotional) Promise me you’ll keep in touch. He hands Mike and Sulley his business card, which has “sa scratched out and “scare student” written in. Mike looks the card.  148.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You’re the scariest bunch of monsters I have ever met. Don’t let anyone tell you different. Everyone goes in for a group hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike and Sulley walk toward the gate with their bags.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: So, what now?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, for the first time in my life, I don’t really have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: You're the great Mike Wazowski! You'll come up with something.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I think it’s time I leave the greatness to other monsters. I’m okay just being, okay. Mike’s bus pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So long, Sull.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: So long. Mike and Sulley shake hands then Mike steps on to the bus The bus takes off. Sulley watches it leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike stares ahead from his seat on the bus. ON SULLEY, he looks down, unsure what to do.... Back on Mike, who stares out the window at the campus he leaving.... Suddenly, two blue arms reach into the window, it’s Sulle

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Wazowski!  149.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Aah!

dialogues.speaker: WHOA
dialogues.text: Startled Sulley falls back out the window. Mike calls up to the bus driver.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Stop the bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike steps off the bus as Sulley is running down the stre

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Mike, I don’t know a single scarer who can do what you do. I know everyone sees us together, they think I’m the one running the show, but the truth is I’ve been riding YOUR coattails since day one. You made the deal with Hardscrabble, you took a hopeless team and made them champions. All I did was catch a pig.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (sotto) Technically, I caught the pig.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (laughing) EXACTLY! And you think you’re just "okay"? You pulled off the biggest scare this school has ever seen!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: That wasn’t me.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: That WAS you. You think I coulda done that without you? I didn’t even bring a pencil on the first day of school! Mike smiles.  150. Sulley’s trying to find the words....

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike, you’re not scary, not even a little...but you are fearless. Mike’s never heard anyone say that before.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if Hardscrabble can’t see that, then she can just--

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: I can just what? Sulley turns around, shocked to see Dean Hardscrabble fly down behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Careful, Mr. Sullivan, I was just warming up to you. Sulley looks down awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE
dialogues.text: Well gentlemen, it seems you made the front page again.... Mike looks at the picture, smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The two of you did something together that no one has ever done before...you surprised me. Perhaps I should keep an eye out for more “surprises” like you in my program. It’s good to hear, but a little late.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But as far as the two of you are concerned, there is nothing I can do for you now. Except perhaps, wish you luck. Mike and Sulley are touched.

dialogues.speaker: HARDSCRABBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Mr. Wazowski...keep surprising people.  151. Mike watches her fly off, looks at the paper, then smiles looks to Sulley.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You know, there is still one way we can work at a scare company. They're always hiring in the mail room. Mike shows Sulley a want ad that reads: “Help Wanted: Mailroom, Monsters, Inc.” Sulley smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK from the MI logo. Mike is beaming, standing nex to Sulley in MI’s mail room.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: This is better than I ever imagined!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I bet we break the all-time record in our first year.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Mike, we're mail guys.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: I know, I’m talking about the record for letters delivered. A big dump of letters come down the shoot. Mike and Sulle brace themselves. Mail Manager THE YETI walks by, reprimanding them.

dialogues.speaker: YETI
dialogues.text: Alright, newbies, quit goofing around. I'’11 have you know tampering with the mail is a crime punishable by banishment.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: Yes, sir!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: We're right on it, Mr. Snowman! (to Sulley) The team of Wazowski and Sullivan are gonna change the world, starting today! Say scream!  152.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, SULLEY
dialogues.text: Scream! Mike takes a picture of he and Sulley in the mail room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of photos of the guys, through time: ..-Mike and Sulley in the mail room - 1st Day Monsters In We pull out to reveal Mike’s locker. It opens to... ..-Mike and Sulley in the mail room - Most Mail Delivered Pan up and we see their picture in the company newsletter ...working as janitors - Meet Your New Janitorial Team Pan over to shot of them in the kitchen... .-.lst Day Cafeteria Workers. Pan up to another newsletter photo... .+.-Team Sullivan and Wazowski serving soup, “SOUP’er Tea Farther up...lst Day Can Wranglers! Then to a flyer that reads...Monsters, Inc. Scare Tryouts We see a shot of Mike showing Sulley how to perform a sca Pan down to....Sulley trying out for a scare job, “Impres New Recruits.” A photo of Mike and Sulley shaking Waternoose’s hand. Mike posts a picture of the two of them in front of Monst Inc. - lst Day Scare Team. We pull out from this picture to see Mike grabbing his ha hat. He walks towards the scare floor with his clipboard hard hat on. Mike is congratulated by other monsters near the floor, a the friends he’s made during his time at MI.

dialogues.speaker: MERV
dialogues.text: Wazowski! Good luck on your first day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Merv.

dialogues.speaker: MI WORKER
dialogues.text: Good luck, Mike!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Thanks fellas! He stops at the line and looks out at the floor. walks past him to work.

dialogues.speaker: SULLEY
dialogues.text: You comin’ coach? Mike smiles and steps over the line.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You better believe it. (exhale)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slug guy slowly enters a classroom.

dialogues.speaker: SLUG
dialogues.text: (running, out of breath) I made it, my first day of class! 153. Sulley Snap zoom out to an empty lecture hall with a janitor sweeping the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JANITOR
dialogues.text: Ehh, the school year’s over, son. You missed it.

dialogues.speaker: SLUG
dialogues.text: Great. Slug guy turns around and very slowly leaves the lecture hall.
